name: St. Rafqa Choboq Ar-Rayès
summary: Rafqa Choboq Ar-Rayès was a Lebanese Maronite nun known for her deep spirituality and acceptance of suffering. Born in Himlaya, Lebanon, she entered religious life and experienced many physical sufferings which she offered to God. She became blind and paralyzed but continued to serve with great faith. She is the first canonized saint of the Lebanese Maronite Order and is venerated as a model of patience and trust in God's will.
